intro: Sobralia anceps, commonly known as the yellow sobralia, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with red veins, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing a sturdy structure for supporting its floral display. Sobralia anceps is valued in horticulture for its vibrant color and unique appearance.
